page.title: 07FARMING TODAY
page.content: Cereals grow on the chalk downs_wheat, oats,barley,peas,beans & rape.Average yields per acre are wheat_3ton,barley & oats _2ton.Peas & beans both yield irregularly.Rape_ 1ton.All crops are fertilized.Diseases are controlled with chemical sprays.Some sheep graze the pasture here & on the heath.Most of the land is owned by 6 freehold farmers,all live locally.Wood belts divide farmland from heath.Fields are large,hedges are neatly trimmed, footpaths well_signed.Some beef cattle graze upland meadows,also horses_ for pleasure.There are no pigs.Each farmer has storage for grain from harvest; uses modern machinery,but only employs 1/2 the men he did 20yrs ago.These men are highly skilled on the land & in machine maintainance.Wild game is rare so pheasants are reared to shoot.
